title: 1. Output and Variables
content:
# Output and Variables


- No Semicolon at the end of the line
- Variables are declared on snake_case
- Variables do not need type declaration
- Do not mix datatypes without typecsting
- Variables can be reassigned
- Printing different data types `print(integer,string)` need to be separated by comma.


```python
# Print Output String
print("Print String")
print(20)

# Variable Assignment
test_variable = 1
string_variable = "test"
failed_subjects = "6"
name = 'John'

# Variable Reassignment
name = 'Eric'

# Variable String Concatenation
print('Dear Mrs Badger')
print('Your son ' + name + ' is failing ' + failed_subjects + ' subjects.')
print(name + ' will need to redo ' + failed_subjects + '  courses.')
print(name + ' is doing well in geography.')
````
